alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 5:17PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nevada, including the following county, Lander. * WHEN...Until 915 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in About 8 MI E of New Pass Summit. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - About 8 MI E of New Pass Summit is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... About 8 MI E of New Pass Summit along US Highway 50 in southern Lander County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
